column4: hmm after installing Samba, looking at the Network > General Tab.  There is no check box for Windows Networking
that doesnt let me setup my windows settings though like domain name etc..
hrm. you're following the wiki page, right?
well, the alternative is to edit /etc/samba/smb.conf
or, possibly easier, you can run 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure samba'
no, i checked if there was a gnome-samba package of some sort, but nothing
for starters, try backing up /etc/samba/smb.conf and run 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure samba'
the reconfigure is a bit useless, sorry
'sudo nano /etc/samba/smb.conf' (or 'gksudo gedit /etc/samba/smb.conf' if your prefer a GUI editor)
i must be off now, sorry. the wiki page is a bit useless; you can try www.samba.org -- they have lots of docs, including 'howtos' for various usage scenarios
